required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Omegaven for Treatment With Parenteral Nutrition Associated Liver Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Omegaven for Treatment With Parenteral Nutrition Associated Liver Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To provide parenteral fat emulsion prepared from fish oil (omega-3 fatty acid emulsion, Omegaven速) to patients with liver disease (PNALD).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a compassionate use protocol for patients with PNALD who have failed traditional treatment to receive Omegaven through an IND. Omegaven will be infused intravenously through either a central or peripheral catheter in conjunction with parenteral nutrition.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a compassionate use protocol for patients with PNALD who have failed traditional treatment to receive Omegaven through an IND.

primary_outcome.measure: Disease Progression as Measured by Serum Levels of Hepatic Enzymes
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate whether established parenteral nutrition associated liver disease (PNALD) can be reversed or its progression halted by using a parenteral fat emulsion prepared from fish oil (omega-3 fatty acid emulsion, Omegaven速) as measured by normalization or decrease of serum levels of hepatic enzymes.

arm_group.description: Use of Omegaven for patients with parenteral nutrition associated liver disease.

intervention.description: Expanded Access Therapy with Omegaven will be initiated at a starting dose of 0.5 gm/kg/day to be infused over 24 hrs. After two days of infusion the dose will be increased to 1gm/kg/day.
intervention.other_name: IV Fish Oil Based Lipid Emulsion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The patient will be PN dependent and unable to meet nutritional needs solely by enteral nutrition.
2. Patient will be <18 years of age.
3. Direct bilirubin > 2.0mg/dl
4. The patient must have failed standard therapies to prevent progression his/her liver disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Other causes of chronic liver disease (Hepatitis C, Cystic fibrosis, biliary atresia, and alpha 1 anti-trypsin deficiency).
2. Patients who are allergic to eggs/shellfish
3. Patients who have severe hemorrhagic disorders.

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: Use of Omegaven for patients with parenteral nutrition associated liver disease. Omegaven: Expanded Access Therapy with Omegaven will be initiated at a starting dose of 0.5 gm/kg/day to be infused over 24 hrs. After two days of infusion the dose will be increased to 1gm/kg/day.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Disease Progression as Measured by Serum Levels of Hepatic Enzymes
outcome.description: To evaluate whether established parenteral nutrition associated liver disease (PNALD) can be reversed or its progression halted by using a parenteral fat emulsion prepared from fish oil (omega-3 fatty acid emulsion, Omegaven速) as measured by normalization or decrease of serum levels of hepatic enzymes.
outcome.population: No results recorded, study was utilized to provide compassionate use of study medication to participants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
